comments.body: client-go too?

In the current form, component-helpers does not depend on client-go. Adding client-go here will make the publishing-bot-verify check fail.

We avoid adding extra deps here to avoid additional lines in the published go.mod file (it renders awkwardly) - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/79330#discussion_r296615365

comments.body:
for future reference, this diff looks like it is doing a lot, but in fact is only doing the following:

1. move controller-manager above kube-controller-manager
2. move cloud-provider above kube-controller-manager
3. fix indentation on `controller-manager` dependencies
4. Add the following diff:

```diff
diff --git b/staging/publishing/rules.yaml a/staging/publishing/rules.yaml
index 66eaed2fe63..ce3d42109c5 100644
--- b/staging/publishing/rules.yaml
+++ a/staging/publishing/rules.yaml
@@ -1109,12 +1109,12 @@ rules:
       branch: master
     - repository: apimachinery
       branch: master
-    - repository: apiserver
-      branch: master
     - repository: client-go
       branch: master
     - repository: component-base
       branch: master
+    - repository: apiserver
+      branch: master
   - source:
       branch: release-1.19
       dir: staging/src/k8s.io/controller-manager
@@ -1133,10 +1133,14 @@ rules:
       branch: master
     - repository: apimachinery
       branch: master
+    - repository: apiserver
+      branch: master
     - repository: client-go
       branch: master
     - repository: component-base
       branch: master
+    - repository: controller-manager
+      branch: master
   - source:
       branch: release-1.16
       dir: staging/src/k8s.io/cloud-provider
@@ -1198,12 +1202,18 @@ rules:
     dependencies:
     - repository: apimachinery
       branch: master
+    - repository: apiserver
+      branch: master
     - repository: component-base
       branch: master
     - repository: api
       branch: master
     - repository: client-go
       branch: master
+    - repository: controller-manager
+      branch: master
+    - repository: cloud-provider
+      branch: master
   - source:
       branch: release-1.16
       dir: staging/src/k8s.io/kube-controller-manager
@@ -1326,12 +1336,16 @@ rules:
       branch: master
     - repository: apimachinery
       branch: master
+    - repository: apiserver
+      branch: master
     - repository: client-go
       branch: master
     - repository: cloud-provider
       branch: master
     - repository: component-base
       branch: master
+    - repository: controller-manager
+      branch: master
   - source:
       branch: release-1.16
       dir: staging/src/k8s.io/csi-translation-lib
@@ -1413,6 +1427,8 @@ rules:
       branch: master
     - repository: component-base
       branch: master
+    - repository: controller-manager
+      branch: master
   - source:
       branch: release-1.16
       dir: staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers
```

comments.body: This seems like a change that should be made in an independent PR?
Without it the test fails, so i added here https://prow.k8s.io/view/gcs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/86034/pull-kubernetes-verify/1223171713915686913
It's possible this came from adding component-base as a dependency of the Kubelet apis subdir. @liggitt @sttts WDYT? Is this change ok?

it is because this adds k8s.io/kubelet -> k8s.io/component-base -> k8s.io/client-go

I'll defer to @sttts on whether that layering makes sense, but I think it probably does
I think the layering makes sense, just wanted to make sure this wasn't an artifact of something else. Thanks!

comments.body: are these changes needed @nikhita @sttts ? I don't think we've done these before when bumping go versions

Yes, these are needed if we are bumping the version in the `release-1.15` branch.

> I don't think we've done these before when bumping go versions

We should have done that. :) Created https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/80151 and https://github.com/kubernetes/publishing-bot/pull/197. 

It doesn't _really_ matter because the go version here is mainly used while testing client-go and there haven't been any particular changes in client-go that are specifically related to features in new go versions, but it's definitely better to bump the version in case there are any bug fixes, etc. :+1:
